intro: Ribes leptanthum var. genuinum, commonly known as the Alaska currant, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of gooseberries and currants. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and produces small, edible berries that are dark red to black in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges, while its flowers are usually pink or white. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks.
